Posts.Content: My husband just got Diagnosed with prostate cancer. PSA was 21.32 T3 Gleason 8 Invasive adenocarcinoma - Gleason score 8 (4,4) core 85% tissue involved- right lateral anterior G score 8(4,4) 85% right lateral prosperier 85% G score 8 (4,4) 40% right posterior G score 8(4,4) 90% right posterior base Left anterior - benign Left lateral- benign Left posterior 7 (4,3) 50 % Left prosposterior base- benign Number score positive 6 Total number cores-11 Primary predominatepatter -grade4 Secondary worst remaining) pattern grade 3 Can any one put this in simple language.. we heard the dr. But now have lots of questions? Dr order bone scan and ct scan to see if it has spread ... is this testing normal Any advice Is appreciated I am more worried then my husband

Posts.Title: Diagnosed today and have questions

Posts.Content: Thanks, bone scan is already set for Friday. My husband is 56 years old and we have been married 33 years. Our family dr. Recommended surgery and the urologist today said he would advice surgery, but wants to wait until bone and ct scan are done to figure out treatment. Fingers crossed...

Posts.Content: My husband was put in a trial, involving hormone therapy which he had his first injection three weeks . Today the doctors decided to do SPRT on three small metastasis on pelvic bone area and prostate... 5 sessions of radiation and two on one small spot on tailbone. Has anyone had SPRT done with hormone therapy
Posts.Signature: PSA Level 21.31 1/19/17 T3 Gleason 8 6/ 11 confirmed cores Right/anterior - 8 (4,4) 85% tissue involvement Right lateral mid- 8(4,4) 85% --60% second core with perineural invasion Right posterior 8(4,4) 40% Right posterior base 8(4,4) 90% Left anterior- benign Left anterior- benign Left lateral mid-x2 benign Left posterior base x2 benign Left posterior apex-7(4,3) 1/1 core 50% Primary pattern -4. Secondary-3 % Gleason score 4 and/or 5 :95 Perineural invasion - present Intaductal carcinoma- present

The urologist mentioned surgery, radiation and hormone therapy last week. He seems very compitant but will definitely ask lots of questions.

Posts.Title: Question about perineural invasion

Posts.Content: Today we saw our neurologist and radiation doctor to talk about options. My husband prostate cancer has metastasized to his pelvic bone, tail bone. Dr was surprised that it is in his bone as PSA Level was 21 and he thought it would be in the surrounding area. He said he wouldn' t remove the prostate as it would be not be beneficial for my husband, radiation is out as my husbamd has Crohns and colitis and he feels that he could cause more damage, with the bowels. Our options are chemo and hormone therapy..... we see an onochologist next week. Dr hopes that this will kill the cancer , slow it down . Has anyone on the form done chemo and hormone tharpy, my husband is only 56 years old... advice
